questions.question: Which article of the ECHR permits derogation in time of emergency?
questions.explanation: Article 15 permits derogation 'in time of war or other public emergency threatening the life of the nation,' but not from Articles 2, 3, 4(1), and 7.

questions.question: Which ECHR rights are absolute and cannot be limited?
options: Prohibition of torture (Art. 3), prohibition of slavery (Art. 4(1)), no punishment without law (Art. 7)
questions.explanation: Articles 3, 4(1), and 7 are absolute rights with no limitation clauses or derogation permitted.

questions.question: What does Article 8 ECHR protect?
options: Right to respect for private and family life, home, and correspondence
questions.explanation: Article 8 ECHR protects private life, family life, home, and correspondence. It's a qualified right.

questions.question: Under Article 10 ECHR (freedom of expression), limitations must be:
options: Prescribed by law, pursuing a legitimate aim, and necessary in a democratic society
questions.explanation: Limitations on Art. 10 must meet the three-part test: prescribed by law, legitimate aim, and necessary in a democratic society.

questions.question: What did the Handyside case establish about Article 10?
options: Freedom of expression applies also to shocking or offensive ideas
States have no margin of appreciation
questions.explanation: Handyside v. UK (1976) stated that Art. 10 protects ideas that 'offend, shock or disturb.'

questions.question: Where is the main UN human rights office located?
questions.explanation: OHCHR headquarters is in Geneva, Switzerland.

questions.question: CAT stands for:
questions.explanation: CAT is the Convention against Torture and Other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment, adopted in 1984.

questions.question: The European Union and the Council of Europe are the same organization.
questions.explanation: They are distinct: the Council of Europe (46 states) focuses on human rights; the EU (27 states) is an economic and political union.

questions.question: The ILO (International Labour Organization) was established in:
questions.explanation: The ILO was established in 1919 as part of the Treaty of Versailles.

questions.question: The first Geneva Convention was adopted in:
questions.explanation: The first Geneva Convention was adopted in 1864, focusing on wounded soldiers.

questions.question: Which UN organ has primary responsibility for international peace and security?
questions.explanation: The Security Council has primary peace/security responsibility.

questions.question: What is the difference between Special Rapporteurs and Working Groups?
options: Rapporteurs are individuals, Working Groups are teams of 5 experts
Rapporteurs are permanent, Working Groups temporary
Rapporteurs focus on countries, Working Groups on themes
questions.explanation: Special Rapporteurs are individual mandate holders; Working Groups consist of 5 experts.

questions.question: What does 'erga omnes' mean in human rights context?
options: Obligations owed to all states/the international community as a whole
questions.explanation: Erga omnes obligations are owed to the international community as a whole.

questions.question: The American Declaration of the Rights and Duties of Man was adopted in:
questions.explanation: The American Declaration was adopted in May 1948, before the UDHR.

questions.question: The African Court on Human and Peoples' Rights can receive cases directly from individuals.
questions.explanation: Generally no - only states and the African Commission can bring cases unless the state made a special declaration.

questions.question: What is a 'pilot judgment' in ECtHR practice?
options: The first judgment of the Court
A test case procedure addressing systemic problems
questions.explanation: Pilot judgments address systemic/structural problems affecting many similar cases.

questions.question: What was the significance of the Marckx v. Belgium case?
options: Recognized positive obligations and rights of children born out of wedlock
questions.explanation: Marckx v. Belgium (1979) was landmark for recognizing positive obligations under Article 8.

questions.question: What did the Osman v. UK case establish?
options: Positive obligation to protect life from criminal acts when authorities know of risk
questions.explanation: Osman v. UK (1998) established the 'Osman test' for positive obligations under Art. 2.

questions.question: The Hirst v. UK case concerned:
questions.explanation: Hirst v. UK (No. 2) (2005) found UK's blanket ban on prisoner voting violated Protocol 1, Article 3.

questions.question: What is the Optional Protocol to ICESCR about?
options: Establishes individual communications procedure for ICESCR
questions.explanation: The OP-ICESCR (2008) establishes individual communications procedures for ICESCR.

questions.question: How often does the UPR review each state?
questions.explanation: In the third cycle, all 193 UN members are reviewed every 4.5 years.

questions.question: What are 'Concluding Observations' issued by treaty bodies?
options: Recommendations to states after examining their periodic reports
questions.explanation: Concluding Observations are recommendations issued after examining a state's periodic report.

questions.question: The views of the Human Rights Committee in individual communications are legally binding.
questions.explanation: Views are not legally binding like court judgments, but states are expected to comply in good faith.

questions.question: Which court interprets EU law, including the Charter of Fundamental Rights?
options: Court of Justice of the European Union
questions.explanation: The CJEU (Luxembourg) interprets EU law including the Charter.

questions.question: What is the FRA?
options: Fundamental Rights Agency of the EU
questions.explanation: The European Union Agency for Fundamental Rights (FRA) provides advice on fundamental rights.

questions.question: What is the 'solange' doctrine?
options: A German constitutional principle limiting EU law primacy regarding rights protection
questions.explanation: The German Federal Constitutional Court's Solange decisions established it would review EU acts for fundamental rights.

questions.question: What are 'second generation' rights?
questions.explanation: Second generation rights are economic, social, and cultural rights.

questions.question: What does 'progressive realization' mean regarding ESC rights?
options: Rights get better over time automatically
States must progressively achieve full realization using maximum available resources
Only progressive states have these rights
questions.explanation: Article 2 ICESCR requires states to take steps 'to the maximum of available resources' to achieve rights.

questions.question: What are 'minimum core obligations' in ESC rights?
options: Obligations to ensure minimum essential levels of rights regardless of resources
questions.explanation: CESCR General Comment 3 established minimum core obligations for essential levels of rights.

questions.question: What are the 'Paris Principles' concerning?
options: Standards for national human rights institutions (NHRIs)
questions.explanation: The Paris Principles (1993) set international standards for NHRIs.

questions.question: What is the ICC?
questions.explanation: The ICC (Rome Statute, 1998) prosecutes individuals for genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes.

questions.question: The ICC can only prosecute when national courts are unwilling or unable to do so (complementarity principle).
questions.explanation: The complementarity principle means the ICC is a court of last resort.

questions.question: Human Rights Day is celebrated on which date?
questions.explanation: Human Rights Day is December 10, commemorating the UDHR adoption.

questions.question: The Nuremberg Trials were significant for human rights because:
options: They established individual criminal responsibility for international crimes
They created the first human rights treaty
questions.explanation: Nuremberg established that individuals can be held criminally responsible for international crimes.

questions.question: Which was the first case decided by the European Court of Human Rights?
questions.explanation: Lawless v. Ireland (1961) was the first case decided on merits by the ECtHR.

questions.question: What principle did the Golder v. UK case establish?
options: Right to access to court is implicit in Article 6
questions.explanation: Golder v. UK (1975) established that the right of access to a court is implicit in Article 6.

questions.question: The Ireland v. UK case was significant for:
options: Distinguishing between torture and inhuman/degrading treatment
questions.explanation: Ireland v. UK (1978) distinguished torture from inhuman and degrading treatment.

questions.question: What changed with the Brighton Declaration (2012)?
options: Emphasized subsidiarity, margin of appreciation, and Court reform
questions.explanation: The Brighton Declaration led to Protocol 15 and continuing reform efforts.

questions.question: How many judges sit in an ECtHR Grand Chamber?
questions.explanation: Grand Chamber consists of 17 judges.

questions.question: A Chamber of the ECtHR typically consists of how many judges?
questions.explanation: A Chamber consists of 7 judges.

questions.question: What is an 'interim measure' (Rule 39) at the ECtHR?
options: Urgent measure to prevent irreparable harm pending full consideration
questions.explanation: Rule 39 allows urgent measures to prevent irreparable harm.

questions.question: ECtHR interim measures under Rule 39 are legally binding on states.
questions.explanation: Following Mamatkulov v. Turkey (2005), Rule 39 measures are considered binding.

questions.question: Which treaty focuses specifically on the rights of persons with disabilities?
questions.explanation: The CRPD (2006) focuses on disability rights with a social model of disability.

questions.question: What is unique about the CRPD's approach to disability?
options: Adopts social/human rights model viewing disability as interaction between impairments and barriers
questions.explanation: CRPD adopts the social/human rights model of disability.

questions.question: What was the 'Commission on Human Rights'?
options: Current main UN human rights body
Predecessor to HRC, criticized for politicization, replaced in 2006
questions.explanation: The Commission (1946-2006) was replaced by the Human Rights Council.

questions.question: What is the 'respect, protect, fulfill' framework?
options: Typology of state obligations: not violate, prevent third-party violations, take positive steps
questions.explanation: This framework describes state obligations: respect, protect, and fulfill rights.

questions.question: In ECHR terminology, what is 'just satisfaction' under Article 41?
options: Compensation the Court may award when domestic law allows only partial reparation
questions.explanation: Article 41 allows the Court to afford 'just satisfaction' (usually monetary compensation).

questions.question: What did the M.C. v. Bulgaria case establish?
options: Positive obligation to penalize and prosecute rape effectively
questions.explanation: M.C. v. Bulgaria (2003) established positive obligations regarding rape prosecution.

questions.question: The Chahal v. UK case established what regarding Article 3?
options: Prohibition of torture is absolute - no deportation to face torture regardless of national security
questions.explanation: Chahal (1996) confirmed Article 3 is absolute: no deportation to face torture.

questions.question: What principle did the Kudla v. Poland judgment establish?
options: Article 13 requires remedy for excessive length of proceedings
questions.explanation: Kudła v. Poland (2000) held that Article 13 requires an effective remedy for length of proceedings.

questions.question: What does 'exhaustion of domestic remedies' mean?
options: Applicant must use available national remedies before applying to ECtHR
questions.explanation: Under Article 35(1) ECHR, applicants must exhaust effective domestic remedies first.

questions.question: What is the time limit for applying to the ECtHR after final domestic decision?
questions.explanation: Protocol 15 changed the time limit from 6 months to 4 months.

questions.question: What are 'qualified rights' in the ECHR?
options: Rights that can be limited under specified conditions
questions.explanation: Qualified rights (Arts. 8-11) can be limited if prescribed by law, with legitimate aim, and necessary.

questions.question: The right to property is contained in the main text of the ECHR.
questions.explanation: The right to property is in Protocol 1, Article 1, not the main Convention text.

questions.question: Protocol 1 to the ECHR covers which rights?
questions.explanation: Protocol 1 (1952) adds protection of property, right to education, and right to free elections.

questions.question: What is 'horizontal effect' (Drittwirkung) of human rights?
options: Human rights norms apply in private relations between individuals
questions.explanation: Drittwirkung refers to whether human rights apply between private parties.

questions.question: What principle did the Von Hannover v. Germany cases develop?
options: Balance between right to privacy and freedom of expression
questions.explanation: Von Hannover cases developed criteria for balancing privacy and press freedom.

questions.question: The Lautsi v. Italy (Grand Chamber) case concerned:
questions.explanation: Lautsi (2011 GC) found crucifixes in Italian classrooms didn't violate the Convention.

questions.question: What was the significance of S.A.S. v. France regarding the face veil ban?
options: Court accepted 'living together' as legitimate aim; upheld ban
questions.explanation: S.A.S. v. France (2014) accepted 'living together' as a legitimate aim for the ban.

questions.question: What is the Maputo Protocol?
options: Protocol to the African Charter on the Rights of Women in Africa
questions.explanation: The Maputo Protocol (2003) protects women's rights in Africa.

questions.question: What are treaty body 'follow-up procedures'?
options: Mechanisms to monitor state implementation of Views/Concluding Observations
questions.explanation: Follow-up procedures track whether states implement treaty body recommendations.

questions.question: What is the difference between 'hard law' and 'soft law' in human rights?
options: Legally binding treaties vs non-binding declarations/resolutions
questions.explanation: Hard law is legally binding; soft law is not formally binding but may influence law development.

questions.question: The UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights are:
options: Soft law framework of 'Protect, Respect, Remedy'
questions.explanation: The UNGPs (2011) are a soft law framework for business and human rights.

questions.question: What is 'transitional justice'?
options: Measures to address past human rights violations after conflict
questions.explanation: Transitional justice encompasses measures to address legacies of massive human rights abuses.

questions.question: What is the 'Responsibility to Protect' (R2P)?
options: Political commitment that sovereignty implies responsibility to protect from atrocities
questions.explanation: R2P (2005) is a political commitment about state responsibility to protect populations from atrocities.

questions.question: Who was the first UN High Commissioner for Human Rights?
questions.explanation: José Ayala-Lasso served as the first High Commissioner from 1994-1997.

questions.question: Who can bring inter-state cases to the ECtHR?
options: Any state party against another state party
questions.explanation: Under Article 33 ECHR, any state party may refer alleged violations by another state party.

questions.question: The European Social Charter is part of the ECHR system.
questions.explanation: The European Social Charter is a separate Council of Europe treaty with its own monitoring system.

questions.question: What is the collective complaints procedure under the European Social Charter?
options: NGOs and social partners can lodge complaints alleging non-compliance
questions.explanation: The 1995 Additional Protocol allows certain organizations to bring collective complaints.

questions.question: What is the CPT?
options: European Committee for the Prevention of Torture
questions.explanation: The CPT conducts visits to places of detention in CoE states.

questions.question: The Arab Charter on Human Rights entered into force in:
questions.explanation: The revised Arab Charter entered into force in 2008.

questions.question: What is the ASEAN Intergovernmental Commission on Human Rights (AICHR)?
options: A consultative body on human rights without protection mandate
questions.explanation: AICHR (2009) is primarily a consultative body for promotion of human rights.

questions.question: What is 'fragmentation' in international human rights law?
options: Proliferation of overlapping regimes potentially leading to conflicting interpretations
questions.explanation: Fragmentation refers to proliferation of tribunals that may issue different interpretations.

questions.question: What is the purpose of state reporting to treaty bodies?
options: States report on measures taken to implement treaty obligations
questions.explanation: States submit periodic reports on implementation; treaty bodies examine and provide recommendations.

questions.question: The UN was founded in:
questions.explanation: The United Nations was founded on October 24, 1945.

questions.question: What is PACE?
options: Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe
Protection Agency for Citizens in Europe
questions.explanation: PACE is the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe, one of its main organs.

questions.question: What is ECOSOC's role in human rights?
options: Oversees some human rights mechanisms and coordinates with specialized agencies
questions.explanation: ECOSOC has a coordinating role and originally oversaw the Commission on Human Rights.

questions.question: What does ICRMW stand for?
options: International Convention on Rights of Migrant Workers
International Committee for Rights of Military Workers
International Council on Refugee and Migrant Welfare
International Convention on Religious and Minority Welfare
questions.explanation: ICRMW is the International Convention on the Protection of the Rights of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families (1990).

questions.question: What is ICPPED?
options: International Convention for Protection of Prisoners and Detained
International Convention for Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance
International Committee on Prevention of Political and Economic Discrimination
International Council for Protection of the Environment and Development
questions.explanation: ICPPED (2006) is the International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance.

questions.question: What is the SPT?
questions.explanation: The SPT is created by OPCAT to conduct visits to places of detention.

questions.question: The UN Security Council can refer situations to the ICC.
questions.explanation: The Security Council can refer situations to the ICC under Chapter VII, even for non-states parties to the Rome Statute.

questions.question: The Tokyo Trials after WWII focused on:
options: Japanese war crimes and crimes against peace
questions.explanation: The International Military Tribunal for the Far East (1946-1948) tried Japanese leaders for war crimes and crimes against peace.

questions.question: What is the principle of 'universality' of human rights?
options: Rights apply only universally, not individually
Human rights apply to all persons regardless of nationality, culture, or other status
Rights are universal across all treaties
questions.explanation: Universality means human rights apply to all human beings by virtue of their humanity.

questions.question: What is the Venice Commission?
options: The Council of Europe's advisory body on constitutional matters
questions.explanation: The Venice Commission (European Commission for Democracy through Law) advises on constitutional law.

questions.question: What are National Preventive Mechanisms (NPMs)?
options: Bodies required by OPCAT to conduct regular visits to places of detention
questions.explanation: OPCAT requires states to establish NPMs to conduct preventive visits to all places of detention.

questions.question: What is the significance of the Kadi case in EU law?
options: CJEU reviewed UN Security Council sanctions for fundamental rights compliance
questions.explanation: Kadi (2008) established that EU courts can review implementation of UN sanctions for fundamental rights.

questions.question: What is the Durban Declaration and Programme of Action?
options: Outcome of 2001 World Conference against Racism
questions.explanation: The Durban Declaration (2001) addressed racism, racial discrimination, xenophobia, and related intolerance.

questions.question: What is 'intersectionality' in human rights?
options: How multiple forms of discrimination interact and compound
Intersection of national and international law
questions.explanation: Intersectionality recognizes that individuals may face multiple, intersecting forms of discrimination.

questions.question: What is the principle of 'subsidiarity' in the ECHR system?
options: States are subsidiary to the Court
Primary responsibility lies with states; ECtHR is subsidiary mechanism
Regional systems are subsidiary to UN
questions.explanation: Subsidiarity means states have primary responsibility for protecting rights; the ECtHR plays a subsidiary role.

questions.question: How many members does ECOSOC have?
questions.explanation: ECOSOC has 54 member states elected by the General Assembly for three-year terms.

questions.question: The Organization of American States (OAS) was established in:
questions.explanation: The OAS was established in 1948 by the Charter of Bogotá.

questions.question: The African Union was established in:
questions.explanation: The AU was established in 2002, succeeding the Organization of African Unity (OAU, 1963).

questions.question: What is the 'Limburg Principles'?
questions.explanation: The Limburg Principles (1986) are expert guidelines on the nature and scope of ICESCR obligations.

questions.question: What are the 'Maastricht Guidelines'?
options: Guidelines on violations of economic, social and cultural rights
questions.explanation: The Maastricht Guidelines (1997) elaborate on what constitutes violations of ESC rights.

questions.question: What is the ICJ?
questions.explanation: The ICJ (World Court) is the principal judicial organ of the UN, settling disputes between states.

questions.question: The ICJ can hear human rights cases brought by individuals.
questions.explanation: The ICJ only hears cases between states; individuals cannot bring cases directly to it.

questions.question: The Genocide Convention was adopted in:
questions.explanation: The Convention on the Prevention and Punishment of the Crime of Genocide was adopted in 1948.

questions.question: What are 'third generation' rights?
options: Solidarity/collective rights like right to development, peace, environment
questions.explanation: Third generation rights are collective/solidarity rights including development, peace, and environment.

questions.question: What is the GRECO?
options: Group of States against Corruption (CoE monitoring body)
questions.explanation: GRECO monitors compliance with CoE anti-corruption standards.

questions.question: What is the 'treaty body strengthening process'?
options: UN efforts to make treaty body system more effective and sustainable
questions.explanation: This ongoing process aims to improve efficiency, accessibility, and impact of the treaty body system.

questions.question: Kdaj je bil ustanovljen Svet za človekove pravice (HRC) in kaj je nadomestil?
questions.explanation: Svet za človekove pravice je bil ustanovljen leta 2006 s sklepom 60/251 Generalne skupščine ZN, da bi nadomestil Komisijo za človekove pravice, ki je bila podvržena politizaciji.

questions.question: Katera institucija je sekretariat za vse človekovopravne organe ZN?
questions.explanation: Varuh človekovih pravic ZN (OHCHR) je sekretariat za vse človekovopravne organe ZN, vključno s Svetom za človekove pravice in devetimi odbori za pogodbe.

questions.question: Kaj je osnovni namen Splošnega periodičnega pregleda (SPP/UPR)?
options: Pregledati poročila držav o izvajanju gospodarskih reform
Ocena uresničevanja človekovih pravic v vseh državah članicah ZN
Pregledati delovanje sodišč za človekove pravice
questions.explanation: SPP/UPR je mehanizem, ki ocenjuje uresničevanje človekovih pravic v vseh 193 državah članicah ZN, ne glede na njihov razvojni nivo ali podpisane pogodbe.

questions.question: Kateri od naslednjih ni eden izmed devetih odborov za človekovopravne pogodbe ZN?
options: Odbor za ekonomske, socialne in kulturne pravice (CESCR)
questions.explanation: Svet za človekove pravice je politično telo, ne pa eden izmed devetih strokovnih odborov za človekovopravne pogodbe.

questions.question: Kaj je glavna funkcija posebnih postopkov Sveta za človekove pravice?
options: Neodvisno preiskovanje tematskih ali državnih človekovopravnih vprašanj
Izvajanje kazenskih postopkov proti kršiteljem človekovih pravic
Spremljanje izvajanja Splošne deklaracije človekovih pravic
questions.explanation: Posebni postopki so neodvisni strokovnjaki, ki preiskujejo tematska (npr. pravica do stanovanja) ali državna (npr. situacija v Eritreji) človekovopravna vprašanja.

questions.question: Katera pogodba se osredotoča na ekonomske, socialne in kulturne pravice?
options: Mednarodni pakt o državljanskih in političnih pravicah (ICCPR)
Mednarodni pakt o ekonomskih, socialnih in kulturnih pravicah (ICESCR)
Konvencija o odpravi vseh oblik diskriminacije žensk (CEDAW)
questions.explanation: ICESCR je eden izmed dveh temeljnih človekovopravnih paktof, ki se osredotoča na ekonomske, socialne in kulturne pravice kot so pravica do dela, izobraževanja, zdravja in stanovanja.

questions.question: Katera pravica je absolutna in nima dopustnih omejitev pod nobenimi pogoji?
options: Pravica do zasebnega in družinskega življenja
questions.explanation: Prepoved mučenja in nečloveškega ravnanja (člen 3 ICCPR) je absolutna pravica, ki nima nobenih izjem ali dopustnih omejitev, niti v času vojne ali izrednih razmer.

questions.question: Kateri odbor nadzoruje izvajanje Konvencije o odpravi vseh oblik diskriminacije žensk (CEDAW)?
options: Odbor za ekonomske, socialne in kulturne pravice
questions.explanation: Odbor za odpravo diskriminacije žensk (CEDAW Committee) je strokovno telo, ki nadzoruje izvajanje CEDAW pogodbe.

questions.question: Katera institucija je najvišje sodišče za človekove pravice v Evropi?
options: Komisarka za človekove pravice Sveta Evrope
questions.explanation: Evropsko sodišče za človekove pravice (ECtHR) v Strasbourgu je najvišje sodišče za človekove pravice v Evropi, ki sodi v zadevah kršitev Evropske konvencije o človekovih pravicah.

questions.question: Katera konvencija je temeljna pogodba medameriškega sistema varstva človekovih pravic?
options: Ameriška deklaracija o pravicah in dolžnostih človeka
Ameriška konvencija o človekovih pravicah (Pakt iz San Joseja)
Afriška listina o človekovih pravicah in pravicah narodov
questions.explanation: Ameriška konvencija o človekovih pravicah (Pakt iz San Joseja) iz leta 1969 je temeljna pogodba medameriškega sistema.

questions.question: Katera institucija je glavno sodišče Afriške unije za človekove pravice?
options: Afriško sodišče za človekove in pravice narodov
Afriška komisija za človekove in pravice narodov
Afriški svet za mir in varnost
questions.explanation: Afriško sodišče za človekove in pravice narodov (ACmHPR) v Tanzaniji je glavno sodišče Afriške unije za človekove pravice, ustanovljeno leta 2004.

questions.question: Katera regija ima človekovopravni sistem, ki vključuje tudi 'pravice narodov'?
questions.explanation: Afriška listina o človekovih pravicah in pravicah narodov (Banjulska listina) iz leta 1981 edina vključuje tudi pravice narodov, kot so pravica do samoodločbe in pravica do razvoja.

questions.question: Katera konvencija posebej naslavlja pravice otrok?
options: Mednarodni pakt o državljanskih in političnih pravicah
questions.explanation: Konvencija o pravicah otrok (CRC) iz leta 1989 je najbolj ratificirana človekovopravna pogodba, ki posebej naslavlja pravice otrok.

questions.question: Kaj je glavna značilnost Konvencije proti prisilnim izginotvam (ICPPED)?
options: Prepoved izginotij in obveznost države, da preiskuje
questions.explanation: ICPPED iz leta 2006 prepoveduje prisilna izginotja in obvezuje države, da preiskujejo takšne primere ter kaznujejo odgovorne.

questions.question: Katera pravica je posebej zaščitena v Konvenciji o pravicah oseb s posebnimi potrebami (CRPD)?
options: Pravica do dostopa do informacij in komunikacije
questions.explanation: CRPD iz leta 2006 temelji na socialnem modelu invalidnosti in zaščitu vseh človekovih pravic za osebe s posebnimi potrebami, vključno z delom, izobraževanjem in dostopom do informacij.

questions.question: Kaj je koncept 'progressive realization' v kontekstu ekonomskih in socialnih pravic?
options: Pravice se uresničujejo takoj in popolnoma
Države morajo postopoma uresničevati pravice glede na razpoložljive vire
Pravice so vedno podvržene političnim odločitvam
Pravice so manj pomembne kot državljanske pravice
questions.explanation: Koncept 'progressive realization' iz člena 2(1) ICESCR pomeni, da države morajo postopoma uresničevati ekonomske in socialne pravice z vsemi razpoložljivimi sredstvi, vendar imajo tudi takojšnje obveznosti (npr. prepoved retrocesije).

questions.question: Kaj pomeni koncept 'univerzalnosti' človekovih pravic?
options: Pravice veljajo le za razvite države
Pravice so enake v vseh kulturah
Pravice veljajo za vse ljudi ne glede na državljanstvo, kulturo ali status
Pravice se lahko razlikujejo glede na religijo
questions.explanation: Univerzalnost pomeni, da človekove pravice veljajo za vse ljudi povsod na svetu, ne glede na njihov položaj, kulturo ali državljanstvo. To je osnovno načelo človekovih pravic, čeprav obstajajo pomisleki glede kulturnega relativizma.

questions.question: Kaj so 'tretje generacije' človekovih pravic?
options: Skupinske/solidarne pravice kot pravica do razvoja, okolja, miru
questions.explanation: Tretje generacije pravic so skupinske ali solidarne pravice, ki vključujejo pravico do razvoja, čistega okolja, miru in dediščine.

questions.question: Kaj je glavna funkcija posebnih poročevalcev Sveta ZN za človekove pravice?
questions.explanation: Posebni poročevalci so neodvisni strokovnjaki, ki preiskujejo specifične človekovopravne teme (npr. mučenje, svoboda izražanja) ali situacije v posameznih državah.

questions.question: Katera regija ima mehanizem za človekove pravice, ki vključuje tako komisijo kot sodišče?
questions.explanation: Vse tri regije (Evropa, Amerika, Afrika) imajo tako komisijo kot sodišče za človekove pravice, čeprav z različnimi pooblastili in strukturami.

questions.question: Kateri člen MPDPP določa pravico do izobraževanja za narodnostne skupnosti?
questions.explanation: Člen 27 MPDPP zagotavlja pravico narodnostnih manjšin do kulturne, verske in jezikovne identitete, vključno z izobraževanjem.

questions.question: Kaj je 'reserva', 'izjava' in 'objekt' v kontekstu MPDPP?
options: Načini, kako države interpretirajo ali omejijo pogodbo
questions.explanation: Države lahko ob ratifikaciji MPDPP oddajo 'reserve' (izjeme), 'izjave' (interpretacije) ali 'objekte' (omejitve), ki vplivajo na obseg njihovih obveznosti.

questions.question: Kaj je 'minimum core obligation' v kontekstu ICESCR?
options: Osnovna raven pravic, ki jo morajo zagotoviti vse države
questions.explanation: Koncept 'minimum core obligation' iz splošnega komentarja št. 3 CESCR pomeni, da imajo države takojšnje obveznosti za zagotavljanje osnovne ravni ekonomskih in socialnih pravic, ne glede na razpoložljive vire.

questions.question: Kateri dodatni protokol omogoča posameznikom, da vložijo pritožbe na CESCR odbor?
options: Dodatni protokol k ICESCR o posamičnih komunikacijah
questions.explanation: Dodatni protokol k ICESCR o posamičnih komunikacijah, ki je začel veljati leta 2013, omogoča posameznikom, da vložijo pritožbe na CESCR odbor.

questions.question: Kako pogosto se vsaka država pregleda v okviru SPP/UPR?
questions.explanation: V tretjem ciklusu SPP/UPR se vsaka od 193 držav pregleda vsakih 4,5 let, kar pomeni, da se celoten cikel zaključi vsakih 4,5 leta.

questions.question: Kdo pripravi poročilo o državi za SPP/UPR?
questions.explanation: Vsaka država sama pripravi nacionalno poročilo o uresničevanju človekovih pravic, ki služi kot osnova za pregled v okviru SPP/UPR.

questions.question: Katera pravica je najbolj ogrožena v kontekstu migracij in beguncev?
options: Pravica do dostopa do dela in izobraževanja
questions.explanation: Begunci in migranti pogosto nimajo dostopa do osnovnih pravic kot so delo, izobraževanje in zdravstvena oskrba, kar je ključno vprašanje v mednarodnem varstvu človekovih pravic.

questions.question: Kaj je glavna težava pri uresničevanju pravice do čistega okolja?
options: Pomanjkanje pravnih mehanizmov za preprečevanje onesnaževanja
questions.explanation: Čeprav je pravica do čistega okolja prepoznana v številnih mednarodnih dokumentih, pogosto manjka jasna pravna definicija in učinkoviti mehanizmi za uveljavljanje te pravice.

questions.question: Katera konvencija posebej naslavlja pravice žensk?
options: Konvencija o odpravi vseh oblik diskriminacije žensk (CEDAW)
questions.explanation: CEDAW je temeljna konvencija, ki posebej naslavlja pravice žensk in obvezuje države, da odpravijo diskriminacijo na podlagi spola.

questions.question: Kaj je 'margin of appreciation' v kontekstu Evropske konvencije?
options: Prostor za nacionalno presojo držav pri izvajanju pravic
questions.explanation: Koncept 'margin of appreciation' ECtHR pomeni, da države imajo določen prostor za lastno presojo pri izvajanju človekovih pravic, zlasti pri kvalitativnih in družbenih vprašanjih.

questions.question: Kaj je glavni izziv 'kulturnega relativizma' za univerzalnost človekovih pravic?
options: Uporaba kot izgovor za kršenje človekovih pravic
questions.explanation: Kulturni relativizem se pogosto uporablja kot izgovor za kršenje človekovih pravic, kar ogroža univerzalnost teh pravic. Mednarodna skupnost poudarja, da človekove pravice so univerzalne in ne podvržene kulturnim izgovorom.

questions.question: Kako je ruska agresija v Ukrajini vplivala na človekove pravice v severni Evropi?
options: Povečala je begunski tok in pritisk na sisteme azila
questions.explanation: Ruska agresija v Ukrajini je imela številne posledice za človekove pravice v severni Evropi, vključno z begunskimi tokovi, pritiskom na sisteme azila, povečanjem nacionalizma in populizma ter vprašanji financiranja človekovih pravic.

questions.question: Kaj je glavna težava pri mednarodnem varstvu človekovih pravic v kontekstu Izraela in Palestine?
options: Nepopolno izvajanje mednarodnega prava in neodvisnost mednarodnih organov
questions.explanation: Glavna težava pri varstvu človekovih pravic v kontekstu Izraela in Palestine je nepopolno izvajanje mednarodnega prava in vprašanja neodvisnosti mednarodnih organov pri preiskovanju kršitev.

questions.question: Kaj je 'responsibility to protect' (R2P)?
options: Dolžnost držav, da zaščitijo svoje državljane pred zunanjo agresijo
Načelo, da ima mednarodna skupnost odgovornost za zaščito prebivalstva pred genocidom, vojno hudodelstvom, etničnim čiščenjem in zatiranjem
Načelo, da države ne smejo posegati v notranje zadeve drugih držav
questions.explanation: Načelo 'responsibility to protect' (R2P), sprejeto leta 2005, poudarja, da ima mednarodna skupnost odgovornost za zaščito prebivalstva pred genocidom, vojno hudodelstvom, etničnim čiščenjem in zatiranjem, če država tega ne stori sama.

questions.question: Kaj je glavna značilnost 'populizma' v kontekstu človekovih pravic?
options: Uporaba nacionalistične retorike za napade na človekove pravice
questions.explanation: Populizem pogosto uporablja nacionalistično retoriko za napade na človekove pravice, zlasti pravice manjšin, priseljencev in drugih ranljivih skupin.

questions.question: Kako vpliva tehnologija na človekove pravice, kot je zasebnost?
options: Ustvarja nove izzive za zaščito zasebnosti in nadzor nad podatki
questions.explanation: Tehnologija, zlasti digitalna, ustvarja nove izzive za zaščito zasebnosti in nadzor nad osebnimi podatki, kot je razvidno iz primerov kot je Snowdenov primer.

questions.question: Kaj je glavni namen filma 'Citizenfour'?
options: Razkritje obsega nadzora obveščevalnih služb nad zasebnostjo
questions.explanation: Film 'Citizenfour' razkriva obseg nadzora obveščevalnih služb (predvsem NSA) nad zasebnostjo posameznikov in dvigne zavezanost zaščiti pravice do zasebnosti.

questions.question: Kaj je 'jus cogens' v mednarodnem pravu?
options: Imperativne norme mednarodnega prava, ki jih ni mogoče odstopati
questions.explanation: 'Jus cogens' so imperativne norme mednarodnega prava (npr. prepoved genocida, mučenja, suženjstva), ki jih ni mogoče odstopati z mednarodnimi pogodbami.

questions.question: Kaj je 'erga omnes' obveznost?
options: Obveznost do vseh držav svetovne skupnosti
questions.explanation: 'Erga omnes' obveznosti so dolžnosti držav do mednarodne skupnosti kot celote, na primer v zvezi s temeljnimi človekovimi pravicami.

questions.question: Kaj je glavni namen 'dodatnih protokolov' k človekovopravnim pogodbam?
options: Uvajanje novih mehanizmov za zaščito pravic
questions.explanation: Dodatni protokoli k človekovopravnim pogodbam pogosto uvajajo nove mehanizme za zaščito pravic, kot so posamične komunikacije ali pravica do pritožbe.

questions.question: Katere pravice sta študenti analizirali pri Seminarju 1 (MPDPP)?
questions.explanation: Seminar 1 se osredotoča na analizo člena 18 (svoboda misli, vesti in vere) in člena 27 (pravice narodnostnih manjšin) v državnih poročilih.

questions.question: Katere izjave države pogosto vlagajo ob ratifikaciji MPDPP?
options: Razlage člena 40 in omejitev individualnih pritožb
questions.explanation: Države pogosto vlagajo razlage glede člena 40 (poročanje) ter omejujejo individualne pritožbe po Prvem dodatnem protokolu.

questions.question: Kaj omogoča Prvi dodatni protokol k MPDPP?
options: Posamezne komunikacije k Odboru za človekove pravice
questions.explanation: Prvi dodatni protokol k MPDPP daje posameznikom pravico, da vložijo pritožbo pri Odboru za človekove pravice po izčrpanju domačih sredstev.

questions.question: Kako pogosto države poročajo Odboru CESCR?
options: Ko jih Svet za človekove pravice pozove
questions.explanation: Države redno poročajo CESCR približno vsakih štiri do pet let, odvisno od koledarja Odbora.

questions.question: Katera obveznost je takojšnja glede ICESCR?
options: Prepoved diskriminacije pri uresničevanju ESC pravic
questions.explanation: Čeprav se ESC pravice uresničujejo postopno, je prepoved diskriminacije takojšnja in ne dopušča odlašanja.

questions.question: Kdo daje priporočila državam v postopku SPP/UPR?
questions.explanation: SPP temelji na meddržavnem vrstniškem pregledu, kjer vse države ZN dajejo priporočila državi v pregledu.

questions.question: Kateri trije dokumenti sestavljajo bazo za razpravo SPP?
options: Nacionalno poročilo, zbirka informacij OHCHR, prispevki deležnikov
Nacionalno poročilo, mnenje ICJ, medijska poročila
Zapisnik posebnega poročevalca, odločba ECtHR, resolucija GS
questions.explanation: Podlaga so nacionalno poročilo, zbirka informacij OHCHR in zbrani prispevki deležnikov (NGO, NHRIs).

questions.question: Kateri sta dve vrsti mandatov posebnih postopkov?
questions.explanation: Posebni postopki so razdeljeni na tematske mandate (npr. mučenje) in državne mandate.

questions.question: Koliko mesecev ima pritožnik po izčrpanju domačih sredstev za vložitev pritožbe na ESČP (po protokolu 15)?
questions.explanation: Po uveljavitvi Protokola 15 se je rok skrajšal na 4 mesece.

questions.question: Kaj je pogoj sprejemljivosti po členu 35 ECHR?
questions.explanation: Pravilo izčrpanja učinkovitih notranjih pravnih sredstev je ključno za sprejemljivost.

questions.question: Kaj je posebnost Afriške listine o človekovih pravicah in pravicah narodov?
questions.explanation: Afriška listina med pravicami vključuje tudi dolžnosti posameznikov.

questions.question: Katere institucije sestavljajo medameriški sistem?
questions.explanation: Medameriški sistem sestavljata Inter-ameriška komisija in Inter-ameriško sodišče za človekove pravice.

questions.question: Kateri dokument je temelj arabske človekovopravne ureditve?
questions.explanation: Arabska listina o človekovih pravicah (2004/2008) je regionalni instrument.

questions.question: Katera omejitev pravice do življenja je dovoljena po MPDPP?
options: Izvedba smrtne kazni v skladu s strogimi pogoji člena 6
Izrek smrtne kazni za politične delikte
questions.explanation: Člen 6 MPDPP dopušča smrtno kazen v državah, kjer še ni ukinjena, a pod zelo strogimi pogoji.

questions.question: Katero orodje dopolnjuje Konvencijo proti mučenju z preventivnimi obiski?
questions.explanation: OPCAT (2002) uvaja pododbor za preprečevanje mučenja in nacionalne preventivne mehanizme.

questions.question: Kaj morajo države storiti po ICPPED?
questions.explanation: ICPPED zahteva kriminalizacijo prisilnih izginotij, preiskave in odškodnine žrtvam.

questions.question: Koliko dodatnih protokolov ima KOP (CRC)?
questions.explanation: CRC ima tri protokole: o otrocih v oboroženih spopadih, o prodaji otrok in o postopkih pritožb.

questions.question: Kaj poudarja Splošna priporočila CEDAW št. 19?
options: Nasilje nad ženskami kot oblika diskriminacije
questions.explanation: GR 19 opredeli nasilje nad ženskami kot obliko diskriminacije in zahteva državne ukrepe.

questions.question: Kateri model invalidnosti sprejema CRPD?
questions.explanation: CRPD temelji na socialnem in človekovopravnem modelu, ki poudarja odstranjevanje ovir.

questions.question: Katera načela sta ključna v Konvenciji o statusu beguncev?
questions.explanation: Konvencija vključuje načelo non-refoulement in določa gospodarske/socialne pravice (npr. delo).

questions.question: Kaj je izmed naštetega ekonomska pravica?
questions.explanation: Pravica do premoženja je ekonomska pravica (npr. čl. 1 Protokola 1 k ECHR).

questions.question: Kateri dokument je leta 1986 priznal pravico do razvoja?
questions.explanation: Deklaracija o pravici do razvoja (1986) priznava razvoj kot človekovo pravico.

questions.question: Kateri mednarodni organ je leta 2022 priznal pravico do čistega okolja kot univerzalno pravico?
questions.explanation: Generalna skupščina ZN je leta 2022 sprejela resolucijo, ki priznava pravico do čistega, zdravega okolja.

questions.question: Kaj morajo države zagotavljati po Konvenciji o genocidu?
questions.explanation: Konvencija iz 1948 zahteva preprečevanje in kaznovanje dejanj genocida.

questions.question: Na katerih temeljih je mogoče omejiti svobodo izražanja po členu 19 ICCPR?
options: Nacionalna varnost, javni red, javno zdravje ali morala
questions.explanation: Člen 19(3) ICCPR dopušča omejitve zaradi spoštovanja pravic drugih ali zaščite nacionalne varnosti, javnega reda, zdravja ali morale.

questions.question: Kaj vključuje svoboda religije po členu 18 ICCPR?
options: Svobodo sprejemati, menjati in prakticirati vero
questions.explanation: Člen 18 vključuje svobodo sprejemati ali spreminjati vero, manifestirati jo individualno ali kolektivno.

questions.question: Katera pravica se pojavi v členu 1 ICCPR in ICESCR?
questions.explanation: Člen 1 obeh paktov potvrjuje pravico narodov do samoodločbe.

questions.question: Kateri evropski dokument posebej ureja manjšinska vprašanja?
options: Okvirna konvencija za varstvo narodnih manjšin
questions.explanation: Okvirna konvencija Sveta Evrope je ključni evropski instrument za varstvo manjšin.

questions.question: Kako populizem vpliva na mednarodne institucije?
options: Pogosto spodkopava zaupanje v institucije in pravila
questions.explanation: Populistične vlade pogosto napadajo legitimnost mednarodnih institucij in človekovopravnih standardov.

questions.question: Na kaj se mora osredotočiti pisna refleksija o Palestini?
options: Na kritično analizo (ne)delovanja mednarodnega režima varstva človekovih pravic
questions.explanation: Refleksija se osredotoča na kritično ovrednotenje (ne)delovanja mednarodnega režima za varstvo človekovih pravic v palestinskem kontekstu.

questions.question: Katero človekovopravno vprašanje izpostavlja Citizenfour?
questions.explanation: Film Citizenfour izpostavlja nadzor nad komunikacijami in kršenje pravice do zasebnosti.

questions.question: Katera resolucija ZN se osredotoča na zaščito zagovornikov človekovih pravic?
questions.explanation: Deklaracija iz leta 1998 potrjuje vlogo zagovornikov človekovih pravic in odgovornost držav za njihovo zaščito.

questions.question: Which document is considered the foundation of modern international human rights protection?
questions.questionSL: Kateri dokument velja za temelj sodobnega mednarodnega varovanja človekovih pravic?
questions.explanation: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR), adopted on December 10, 1948, is the first international document to articulate universal human rights.
questions.explanationSL: Splošna deklaracija človekovih pravic (SDČP), sprejeta 10. decembra 1948, je prvi mednarodni dokument, ki je artikuliral univerzalne človekove pravice.
questions.examTip: Distinguish between legally binding treaties and declarations!

questions.question: When do we celebrate International Human Rights Day?
questions.questionSL: Kdaj praznujemo Mednarodni dan človekovih pravic?
questions.explanation: International Human Rights Day is celebrated on December 10, the anniversary of the adoption of the UDHR in 1948.
questions.explanationSL: Mednarodni dan človekovih pravic praznujemo 10. decembra, na obletnico sprejetja Splošne deklaracije človekovih pravic leta 1948.

questions.question: Who chaired the commission that drafted the UDHR?
questions.questionSL: Kdo je bil predsednik komisije, ki je pripravila osnutek SDČP?
questions.explanation: Eleanor Roosevelt, wife of former US President Franklin D. Roosevelt, chaired the UN Commission on Human Rights that drafted the UDHR. René Cassin was the main author of the text.
questions.explanationSL: Eleanor Roosevelt, žena nekdanjega ameriškega predsednika Franklina D. Roosevelta, je predsedovala Komisiji OZN za človekove pravice, ki je pripravila osnutek SDČP.

questions.question: Which concept refers to the idea that human rights apply to all people regardless of cultural differences?
questions.questionSL: Kateri koncept označuje idejo, da so človekove pravice veljavne za vse ljudi ne glede na kulturne razlike?
questions.explanation: Universality of human rights means that these rights belong to all people solely on the basis of their human dignity. This principle was confirmed in the Vienna Declaration of 1993.
questions.explanationSL: Univerzalnost človekovih pravic pomeni, da te pravice pripadajo vsem ljudem zgolj na podlagi njihovega človeškega dostojanstva. To načelo je potrjeno v Dunajski deklaraciji iz leta 1993.

questions.question: What are the three generations of human rights according to Karel Vasak's classification?
questions.questionSL: Katere so tri generacije človekovih pravic po klasifikaciji Karela Vasaka?
options: Civil and political; economic, social and cultural; solidarity
optionsSL: Državljanske in politične; ekonomske, socialne in kulturne; solidarnostne
questions.explanation: Karel Vasak proposed in 1977 a division into three generations: 1st (blue) - civil and political rights; 2nd (red) - economic, social and cultural rights; 3rd (green) - solidarity/collective rights.
questions.explanationSL: Karel Vasak je leta 1977 predlagal delitev na tri generacije: 1. generacija (modra) - državljanske in politične pravice; 2. generacija (rdeča) - ekonomske, socialne in kulturne pravice; 3. generacija (zelena) - solidarnostne/kolektivne pravice.

questions.question: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights is a legally binding international document.
questions.questionSL: Splošna deklaracija človekovih pravic je pravno zavezujoč mednarodni dokument.
questions.explanation: The UDHR was adopted as a UN General Assembly resolution and as such is not a legally binding treaty. However, many of its provisions have become part of customary international law.
questions.explanationSL: SDČP je bila sprejeta kot resolucija Generalne skupščine OZN in kot taka ni pravno zavezujoča pogodba. Vendar so številne njene določbe postale del mednarodnega običajnega prava.

questions.question: Natural law theory of human rights is based on the idea that rights derive from human dignity and exist independently of the state.
questions.questionSL: Naravnopravna teorija človekovih pravic temelji na ideji, da pravice izhajajo iz človeškega dostojanstva in obstajajo neodvisno od države.
questions.explanation: Natural law theory claims that human rights derive from human nature or dignity and are not granted by the state. This contrasts with legal positivism, which sees rights as a product of positive (state) law.
questions.explanationSL: Naravnopravna teorija trdi, da človekove pravice izhajajo iz človekove narave oziroma dostojanstva in niso podeljene s strani države.

questions.question: What does the 'margin of appreciation' doctrine mean in the context of the ECtHR?
questions.questionSL: Kaj pomeni načelo 'margin of appreciation' v kontekstu ESČP?
options: Absolute prohibition of interference with rights
Discretion that states have in implementing Convention rights
Obligation of the court to consider state opinions
optionsSL: Prostor presoje, ki ga imajo države pri implementaciji konvencijskih pravic
Obveznost sodišča, da upošteva mnenje držav
questions.explanation: The 'margin of appreciation' doctrine means that the ECtHR recognizes states some discretion in implementing Convention rights, especially on sensitive issues where there is no European consensus.
questions.explanationSL: Doktrina 'margin of appreciation' (polje proste presoje) pomeni, da ESČP prizna državam določeno diskrecijo pri implementaciji konvencijskih pravic.
questions.examTip: This is one of the most important concepts for understanding ECtHR case law!

questions.question: Which body succeeded the UN Commission on Human Rights in 2006?
questions.questionSL: Kateri organ je nasledil Komisijo OZN za človekove pravice leta 2006?
questions.explanation: The Human Rights Council was established by General Assembly resolution 60/251 in 2006 as the successor to the Commission on Human Rights.
questions.explanationSL: Svet za človekove pravice je bil ustanovljen z resolucijo Generalne skupščine 60/251 leta 2006 kot naslednik Komisije za človekove pravice.

questions.question: How many member states does the UN Human Rights Council have?
questions.questionSL: Koliko držav članic ima Svet OZN za človekove pravice?
questions.explanation: The Human Rights Council has 47 member states elected by the UN General Assembly for three-year terms. Seats are geographically distributed among regional groups.
questions.explanationSL: Svet za človekove pravice ima 47 držav članic, ki jih izvoli Generalna skupščina OZN za triletne mandate.

questions.question: What is the UPR (Universal Periodic Review)?
questions.questionSL: Kaj je UPR (Universal Periodic Review)?
options: Periodic review of human rights situation in all UN member states
Annual report of the High Commissioner
optionsSL: Periodični pregled stanja človekovih pravic v vseh državah članicah OZN
questions.explanation: The Universal Periodic Review (UPR) is a mechanism of the Human Rights Council that reviews the human rights situation in all 193 UN member states every 4.5 years.
questions.explanationSL: Univerzalni periodični pregled (UPR) je mehanizem Sveta za človekove pravice, v okviru katerega se pregleduje stanje človekovih pravic v vseh 193 državah članicah OZN.
questions.examTip: UPR is a unique mechanism - it covers ALL UN states, not just treaty parties!

questions.question: How many core UN human rights treaties exist?
questions.questionSL: Koliko temeljnih (core) pogodb OZN o človekovih pravicah obstaja?
questions.explanation: There are 9 core UN human rights treaties: ICCPR, ICESCR, CERD, CEDAW, CAT, CRC, CMW, CRPD and CED. Each has its own monitoring body (treaty body).
questions.explanationSL: Obstaja 9 temeljnih pogodb OZN o človekovih pravicah: MPDPP, MPESKP, CERD, CEDAW, CAT, CRC, CMW, CRPD in CED. Vsaka ima svoj nadzorni odbor.

questions.question: Which UN human rights treaty has the most states parties?
questions.questionSL: Katera pogodba OZN o človekovih pravicah ima največ pogodbenic?
options: Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC)
questions.explanation: The Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) from 1989 is the most universally ratified human rights treaty with 196 states parties. The only UN member state that has not ratified it is the USA.
questions.explanationSL: Konvencija o otrokovih pravicah (CRC) iz leta 1989 je najbolj univerzalno ratificirana pogodba o človekovih pravicah s 196 pogodbenicami.
questions.examTip: CRC has near-universal ratification - this is a common exam question!

questions.question: When was the European Convention on Human Rights adopted?
questions.questionSL: Kdaj je bila sprejeta Evropska konvencija o človekovih pravicah?
questions.explanation: The European Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (ECHR) was adopted on November 4, 1950 within the Council of Europe and entered into force on September 3, 1953.
questions.explanationSL: Evropska konvencija o varstvu človekovih pravic in temeljnih svoboščin (EKČP) je bila sprejeta 4. novembra 1950 v okviru Sveta Evrope in je začela veljati 3. septembra 1953.

questions.question: How many states are currently members of the Council of Europe?
questions.questionSL: Koliko držav je trenutno članic Sveta Evrope?
questions.explanation: The Council of Europe currently has 46 member states (after Russia's exclusion in March 2022 due to aggression against Ukraine). All CoE members are parties to the ECHR.
questions.explanationSL: Svet Evrope ima trenutno 46 držav članic (po izključitvi Rusije marca 2022 zaradi agresije na Ukrajino). Vse članice SE so pogodbenice EKČP.
questions.examTip: Don't confuse the Council of Europe (46 members) with the European Union (27 members)!

questions.question: Where is the European Court of Human Rights located?
questions.questionSL: Kje ima sedež Evropsko sodišče za človekove pravice?
questions.explanation: The European Court of Human Rights (ECtHR) is located in Strasbourg, France, where the Council of Europe is also headquartered. Don't confuse it with the EU Court of Justice in Luxembourg.
questions.explanationSL: Evropsko sodišče za človekove pravice (ESČP) ima sedež v Strasbourgu (Francija), kjer je tudi sedež Sveta Evrope.

questions.question: Which article of the ECHR protects the right to life?
questions.questionSL: Kateri člen EKČP varuje pravico do življenja?
questions.explanation: Article 2 ECHR protects the right to life. Article 1 establishes the obligation of states to secure Convention rights. Article 3 prohibits torture, Article 5 protects the right to liberty and security.
questions.explanationSL: Člen 2 EKČP varuje pravico do življenja. Člen 1 določa obveznost držav, da zagotovijo konvencijske pravice. Člen 3 prepoveduje mučenje, člen 5 pa varuje pravico do svobode in varnosti.
questions.examTip: You must know the ECHR articles by heart - this is often on the exam!

questions.question: Which article of the ECHR contains the prohibition of torture?
questions.questionSL: Kateri člen EKČP vsebuje prepoved mučenja?
questions.explanation: Article 3 ECHR states: 'No one shall be subjected to torture or to inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment.' This is an absolute right - it allows no exceptions or limitations, even in time of war or emergency.
questions.explanationSL: Člen 3 EKČP določa: 'Nikogar se ne sme mučiti ali nečloveško in ponižujoče z njim ravnati ali ga kaznovati.' To je absolutna pravica - ne dopušča izjem ali omejitev.
questions.examTip: Article 3 is an ABSOLUTE right - this is essential for understanding the system!

questions.question: ECtHR judgments are legally binding on states parties.
questions.questionSL: Sodbe ESČP so pravno zavezujoče za države pogodbenice.
questions.explanation: Under Article 46 ECHR, ECtHR judgments are legally binding on the respondent state. Execution of judgments is supervised by the Committee of Ministers of the Council of Europe.
questions.explanationSL: Po členu 46 EKČP so sodbe ESČP pravno zavezujoče za toženo državo. Izvajanje sodb nadzoruje Odbor ministrov Sveta Evrope.

questions.question: An individual can lodge an application with the ECtHR only after exhausting domestic remedies.
questions.questionSL: Posameznik lahko vloži pritožbo na ESČP šele po izčrpanju domačih pravnih sredstev.
questions.explanation: Article 35(1) ECHR requires that the applicant must exhaust all domestic remedies before lodging an application. The application must be lodged within four months of the final domestic decision.
questions.explanationSL: Člen 35(1) EKČP določa, da mora pritožnik pred vložitvijo pritožbe izčrpati vsa domača pravna sredstva. Pritožbo mora vložiti v štirih mesecih od končne domače odločitve.

questions.question: When was the American Convention on Human Rights adopted?
questions.questionSL: Kdaj je bila sprejeta Ameriška konvencija o človekovih pravicah?
questions.explanation: The American Convention on Human Rights (also known as the Pact of San José) was adopted on November 22, 1969 and entered into force on July 18, 1978.
questions.explanationSL: Ameriška konvencija o človekovih pravicah (znana tudi kot Pakt iz San Joséja) je bila sprejeta 22. novembra 1969 in je začela veljati 18. julija 1978.

questions.question: What is the name of the main instrument of the African human rights system?
questions.questionSL: Kako se imenuje osrednja listina afriškega sistema človekovih pravic?
options: African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights
African Union Charter of Fundamental Rights
optionsSL: Afriška listina o človekovih pravicah in pravicah ljudstev
Listina Afriške unije o temeljnih pravicah
questions.explanation: The African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights (also known as the Banjul Charter) was adopted in 1981 and entered into force in 1986. It is unique in that it includes peoples' rights and individual duties.
questions.explanationSL: Afriška listina o človekovih pravicah in pravicah ljudstev (znana tudi kot Banjulska listina) je bila sprejeta leta 1981. Edinstvena je po tem, da poleg individualnih pravic vsebuje tudi kolektivne pravice in obveznosti posameznikov.

questions.question: What is unique about the African Charter compared to other regional systems?
questions.questionSL: Kaj je posebnost afriške Listine v primerjavi z drugimi regionalnimi sistemi?
options: It includes only civil and political rights
It applies only to democratic states
optionsSL: Vključuje le državljanske in politične pravice
questions.explanation: The African Charter is unique because it includes individual duties (Articles 27-29) in addition to rights. It also includes peoples' rights and economic, social and cultural rights in the same document.
questions.explanationSL: Afriška listina je edinstvena, ker poleg pravic vključuje tudi dolžnosti posameznikov do družine, družbe, države in mednarodne skupnosti (členi 27-29).
questions.examTip: Individual duties are a unique African innovation - know the examples!

questions.question: What does the principle of 'exhaustion of domestic remedies' mean?
questions.questionSL: Kaj pomeni načelo 'izčrpanja domačih pravnih sredstev'?
options: The state must use all means
The applicant must first use national legal avenues before international ones
International bodies must try all options
optionsSL: Pritožnik mora najprej uporabiti nacionalne pravne poti pred mednarodnimi
Mednarodna telesa morajo preizkusiti vse možnosti
questions.explanation: Exhaustion of domestic remedies is a procedural requirement that the applicant must use all available and effective national legal avenues before lodging an international complaint.
questions.explanationSL: Izčrpanje domačih pravnih sredstev je procesna zahteva, po kateri mora pritožnik pred vložitvijo mednarodne pritožbe najprej uporabiti vse razpoložljive in učinkovite nacionalne pravne poti.

questions.question: What is the time limit to lodge an application with the ECtHR after the final domestic decision?
questions.questionSL: Kakšen je rok za vložitev pritožbe na ESČP po končni domači odločitvi?
questions.explanation: Under Protocol 15, which entered into force in August 2021, the time limit for lodging an application with the ECtHR is 4 months from the final domestic decision (previously 6 months).
questions.explanationSL: Po Protokolu št. 15, ki je začel veljati avgusta 2021, je rok za vložitev pritožbe na ESČP 4 mesece od končne domače odločitve (prej je bil 6 mesecev).
questions.examTip: Note the change! Protocol 15 shortened the deadline from 6 to 4 months!

questions.question: In which case did the ECtHR first systematically apply the 'margin of appreciation' doctrine?
questions.questionSL: V kateri zadevi je ESČP prvič sistematično uporabilo doktorino 'margin of appreciation'?
questions.explanation: The 'margin of appreciation' doctrine was systematically developed in Handyside v. UK (1976), which concerned restrictions on freedom of expression. The Court recognized that it is 'impossible to find in European law a uniform conception of morals'.
questions.explanationSL: Doktrina 'margin of appreciation' je bila sistematično razvita v zadevi Handyside v. UK (1976), ki se je nanašala na omejitve svobode izražanja.

questions.question: When did Slovenia ratify the European Convention on Human Rights?
questions.questionSL: Kdaj je Slovenija ratificirala Evropsko konvencijo o človekovih pravicah?
questions.explanation: Slovenia became a member of the Council of Europe on May 14, 1993, and signed the ECHR on the same day. Ratification followed on June 28, 1994. The ECHR thus entered into force for Slovenia on June 28, 1994.
questions.explanationSL: Slovenija je postala članica Sveta Evrope 14. maja 1993, istega dne je podpisala EKČP. Ratifikacija je sledila 28. junija 1994. EKČP je tako za Slovenijo začela veljati 28. junija 1994.

questions.question: Which body in Slovenia handles constitutional complaints regarding human rights?
questions.questionSL: Kateri organ v Sloveniji je pristojen za ustavne pritožbe v zvezi s človekovimi pravicami?
questions.explanation: The Constitutional Court of the Republic of Slovenia is competent for constitutional complaints (Article 160 of the Constitution), which can challenge violations of constitutional rights by individual acts of state bodies.
questions.explanationSL: Ustavno sodišče RS je pristojno za ustavne pritožbe (člen 160 Ustave), s katerimi se lahko izpodbijajo kršitve ustavnih pravic s posamičnimi akti državnih organov.

questions.question: What is the principle of non-refoulement?
questions.questionSL: Kaj je načelo nevračanja (non-refoulement)?
options: Right to return to one's country
Prohibition of returning a person to a country where they face persecution or torture
optionsSL: Pravica do vrnitve v svojo državo
Prepoved vračanja osebe v državo, kjer ji grozi preganjanje ali mučenje
questions.explanation: Non-refoulement is a fundamental principle of international refugee law (Article 33 of the 1951 Refugee Convention) that prohibits returning refugees to countries where they face serious threats.
questions.explanationSL: Načelo nevračanja je temeljno načelo mednarodnega begunskega prava (člen 33 Ženevske konvencije iz 1951), ki prepoveduje vračanje beguncev v države, kjer jim grozi resna nevarnost.
questions.examTip: Non-refoulement is also protected under Article 3 ECHR (Soering case)!

questions.question: Which convention is the primary international instrument for refugee protection?
questions.questionSL: Katera konvencija je primarni mednarodni instrument za varstvo beguncev?
options: 1951 Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
questions.explanation: The 1951 Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees (and its 1967 Protocol) is the cornerstone of international refugee protection, defining who is a refugee and their rights.
questions.explanationSL: Konvencija o statusu beguncev iz leta 1951 (in njen Protokol iz 1967) je temelj mednarodnega varstva beguncev, ki opredeljuje, kdo je begunec in kakšne so njegove pravice.

questions.question: What is the definition of a refugee under the 1951 Convention?
questions.questionSL: Kakšna je definicija begunca po Konvenciji iz leta 1951?
options: A person with well-founded fear of persecution based on race, religion, nationality, political opinion, or membership in a particular social group
A person seeking better economic opportunities
optionsSL: Oseba z utemeljenim strahom pred preganjanjem zaradi rase, vere, narodnosti, političnega prepričanja ali pripadnosti določeni družbeni skupini
Oseba, ki išče boljše ekonomske priložnosti
questions.explanation: Article 1A(2) of the 1951 Convention defines a refugee as someone with a well-founded fear of persecution for reasons of race, religion, nationality, membership of a particular social group, or political opinion.
questions.explanationSL: Člen 1A(2) Konvencije iz 1951 opredeljuje begunca kot osebo z utemeljenim strahom pred preganjanjem zaradi rase, vere, narodnosti, pripadnosti določeni družbeni skupini ali političnega prepričanja.

questions.question: How does populism typically affect human rights protection?
questions.questionSL: Kako populizem običajno vpliva na varstvo človekovih pravic?
options: It often undermines human rights institutions and norms
It has no effect on human rights
It always improves domestic rights protection
optionsSL: Pogosto spodkopava institucije in norme človekovih pravic
questions.explanation: Populist movements often attack the legitimacy of international human rights institutions, courts, and norms, framing them as elitist or foreign interference (see Roth 2017, Helfer 2020).
questions.explanationSL: Populistična gibanja pogosto napadajo legitimnost mednarodnih institucij, sodišč in norm človekovih pravic ter jih označujejo za elitistične ali tuje vmešavanje.
questions.examTip: Key readings: Roth (2017) 'The Dangerous Rise of Populism' and Helfer (2020) on populism and HR institutions.

questions.question: What are the main threats populism poses to international human rights mechanisms?
questions.questionSL: Katere so glavne grožnje, ki jih populizem predstavlja za mednarodne mehanizme človekovih pravic?
options: Withdrawal from treaties, attacks on courts, and delegitimization of international norms
More ratifications of human rights treaties
optionsSL: Izstop iz pogodb, napadi na sodišča in delegitimizacija mednarodnih norm
Več ratifikacij pogodb o človekovih pravicah
questions.explanation: Populist governments may withdraw from human rights treaties, attack international courts (like the ECtHR or ICC), and undermine the legitimacy of universal human rights standards.
questions.explanationSL: Populistične vlade se lahko umaknejo iz pogodb o človekovih pravicah, napadajo mednarodna sodišča (kot sta ESČP ali MKS) in spodkopavajo legitimnost univerzalnih standardov človekovih pravic.

questions.question: When did the UN General Assembly recognize the right to a clean, healthy and sustainable environment?
questions.questionSL: Kdaj je Generalna skupščina OZN priznala pravico do čistega, zdravega in trajnostnega okolja?
options: It has not been recognized yet
questions.explanation: On July 28, 2022, the UN General Assembly adopted resolution A/RES/76/300 recognizing the right to a clean, healthy and sustainable environment as a universal human right.
questions.explanationSL: 28. julija 2022 je Generalna skupščina OZN sprejela resolucijo A/RES/76/300, ki priznava pravico do čistega, zdravega in trajnostnega okolja kot univerzalno človekovo pravico.

questions.question: Which regional human rights system first recognized the right to a healthy environment in a binding treaty?
questions.questionSL: Kateri regionalni sistem človekovih pravic je prvi priznal pravico do zdravega okolja v zavezujoči pogodbi?
questions.explanation: The African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights (1981) was the first binding regional treaty to include the right to a 'general satisfactory environment' (Article 24).
questions.explanationSL: Afriška listina o človekovih pravicah in pravicah ljudstev (1981) je bila prva zavezujoča regionalna pogodba, ki je vključila pravico do 'splošno zadovoljivega okolja' (člen 24).

questions.question: What human rights issue is central to the documentary 'Citizenfour'?
questions.questionSL: Katero človekovopravno vprašanje je osrednje v dokumentarcu 'Citizenfour'?
options: Right to privacy and mass surveillance
optionsSL: Pravica do zasebnosti in množični nadzor
questions.explanation: Citizenfour (2014) documents Edward Snowden's revelations about NSA mass surveillance programs, raising fundamental questions about the right to privacy in the digital age.
questions.explanationSL: Citizenfour (2014) dokumentira razkritja Edwarda Snowdna o programih množičnega nadzora NSA in odpira temeljna vprašanja o pravici do zasebnosti v digitalni dobi.

questions.question: Which article of the ICCPR protects the right to privacy?
questions.questionSL: Kateri člen MPDPP varuje pravico do zasebnosti?
questions.explanation: Article 17 ICCPR protects against arbitrary or unlawful interference with privacy, family, home, or correspondence.
questions.explanationSL: Člen 17 MPDPP varuje pred samovoljnim ali nezakonitim vmešavanjem v zasebnost, družino, dom ali dopisovanje.

questions.question: What is 'cultural relativism' in the context of human rights?
questions.questionSL: Kaj je 'kulturni relativizem' v kontekstu človekovih pravic?
options: The idea that all cultures are equal
The view that human rights standards should vary according to cultural context
A legal doctrine of the ECtHR
The principle that culture is a human right
optionsSL: Ideja, da so vse kulture enake
Stališče, da bi morali standardi človekovih pravic variirati glede na kulturni kontekst
Načelo, da je kultura človekova pravica
questions.explanation: Cultural relativism argues that human rights cannot be universal because moral standards vary between cultures. Critics argue it is often used to justify human rights violations.
questions.explanationSL: Kulturni relativizem trdi, da človekove pravice ne morejo biti univerzalne, ker se moralni standardi razlikujejo med kulturami. Kritiki trdijo, da se pogosto uporablja za opravičevanje kršitev človekovih pravic.
questions.examTip: Key debate: Is cultural relativism a genuine concern or an excuse to avoid human rights obligations?

questions.question: What are 'Asian values' in the human rights debate?
questions.questionSL: Kaj so 'azijske vrednote' v razpravi o človekovih pravicah?
options: A set of UN standards for Asia
An argument that Asian cultures prioritize community over individual rights
The official position of ASEAN on human rights
optionsSL: Argument, da azijske kulture dajejo prednost skupnosti pred individualnimi pravicami
Uradno stališče ASEAN o človekovih pravicah
questions.explanation: The 'Asian values' argument, prominent in the 1990s, claimed that Asian societies prioritize community harmony and economic development over Western-style individual rights. Critics like Amartya Sen have challenged this view.
questions.explanationSL: Argument 'azijskih vrednot', izrazit v 1990-ih, je trdil, da azijske družbe dajejo prednost skupnostni harmoniji in ekonomskemu razvoju pred zahodnimi individualnimi pravicami.
questions.examTip: Read: Sen, A. (2015) 'Human Rights and Asian Values' - key critique of cultural relativism.

questions.question: What is the right to self-determination?
questions.questionSL: Kaj je pravica do samoodločbe?
options: The right of individuals to make personal choices
The right of peoples to freely determine their political status and pursue their development
The right to vote in elections
The right to leave one's country
optionsSL: Pravica narodov, da svobodno določijo svoj politični status in zasledujejo svoj razvoj
questions.explanation: The right to self-determination (Article 1 of both ICCPR and ICESCR) is a collective right of peoples to freely determine their political status and pursue their economic, social, and cultural development.
questions.explanationSL: Pravica do samoodločbe (člen 1 MPDPP in MPESKP) je kolektivna pravica narodov, da svobodno določijo svoj politični status in zasledujejo svoj ekonomski, socialni in kulturni razvoj.

questions.question: Which international instrument specifically protects minority rights?
questions.questionSL: Kateri mednarodni instrument posebej varuje pravice manjšin?
questions.explanation: Article 27 ICCPR protects the rights of persons belonging to ethnic, religious, or linguistic minorities to enjoy their culture, practice their religion, and use their language.
questions.explanationSL: Člen 27 MPDPP varuje pravice pripadnikov etničnih, verskih ali jezikovnih manjšin, da uživajo svojo kulturo, prakticirajo svojo vero in uporabljajo svoj jezik.
questions.examTip: Also important: Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities (Council of Europe, 1995).

questions.question: What is the right to development?
questions.questionSL: Kaj je pravica do razvoja?
options: The right of states to develop nuclear weapons
An inalienable human right to participate in and benefit from economic, social, cultural, and political development
The right of corporations to expand
optionsSL: Pravica držav do razvoja jedrskega orožja
Neodtujljiva človekova pravica do sodelovanja in uživanja koristi ekonomskega, socialnega, kulturnega in političnega razvoja
questions.explanation: The right to development was proclaimed in the 1986 UN Declaration on the Right to Development as an inalienable human right enabling all peoples to participate in and benefit from development.
questions.explanationSL: Pravica do razvoja je bila razglašena v Deklaraciji OZN o pravici do razvoja iz leta 1986 kot neodtujljiva človekova pravica, ki vsem narodom omogoča sodelovanje in uživanje koristi razvoja.

questions.question: The right to development is considered a 'third generation' or solidarity right.
questions.questionSL: Pravica do razvoja se šteje za pravico 'tretje generacije' oziroma solidarnostno pravico.
questions.explanation: Under Karel Vasak's classification, the right to development is a third-generation (solidarity) right, along with the right to peace, right to a healthy environment, and rights of peoples.
questions.explanationSL: Po klasifikaciji Karela Vasaka je pravica do razvoja pravica tretje generacije (solidarnostna pravica), skupaj s pravico do miru, pravico do zdravega okolja in pravicami narodov.

questions.question: What does the prohibition of genocide include?
questions.questionSL: Kaj vključuje prepoved genocida?
options: Acts committed with intent to destroy a national, ethnic, racial, or religious group
optionsSL: Dejanja, storjena z namenom uničiti nacionalno, etnično, rasno ali versko skupino
Samo zločine, ki jih storijo države
questions.explanation: The 1948 Genocide Convention defines genocide as acts committed with intent to destroy, in whole or in part, a national, ethnical, racial, or religious group, including killing, causing serious harm, imposing conditions to destroy the group, preventing births, or forcibly transferring children.
questions.explanationSL: Konvencija o genocidu iz leta 1948 opredeljuje genocid kot dejanja, storjena z namenom uničiti, v celoti ali delno, nacionalno, etnično, rasno ali versko skupino.

questions.question: Which article of the ECHR protects freedom of expression?
questions.questionSL: Kateri člen EKČP varuje svobodo izražanja?
questions.explanation: Article 10 ECHR protects freedom of expression, including the freedom to hold opinions and to receive and impart information and ideas without interference by public authority.
questions.explanationSL: Člen 10 EKČP varuje svobodo izražanja, vključno s svobodo imeti mnenja ter sprejemati in širiti informacije in ideje brez vmešavanja javne oblasti.

questions.question: Which article of the ECHR protects freedom of religion?
questions.questionSL: Kateri člen EKČP varuje svobodo veroizpovedi?
questions.explanation: Article 9 ECHR protects freedom of thought, conscience and religion, including the freedom to change religion and to manifest religion in worship, teaching, practice, and observance.
questions.explanationSL: Člen 9 EKČP varuje svobodo mišljenja, vesti in vere, vključno s svobodo spremeniti vero in izražati vero v bogoslužju, poučevanju, praksi in obredih.

questions.question: What did the Handyside v. UK case establish about freedom of expression?
questions.questionSL: Kaj je zadeva Handyside proti Združenemu kraljestvu ugotovila o svobodi izražanja?
options: Expression can be limited for any reason
Freedom of expression protects ideas that 'offend, shock or disturb'
States have no margin of appreciation
optionsSL: Izražanje se lahko omeji iz kateregakoli razloga
Svoboda izražanja varuje tudi ideje, ki 'žalijo, šokirajo ali vznemirjajo'
questions.explanation: In Handyside v. UK (1976), the ECtHR held that freedom of expression applies not only to information or ideas that are favorably received, but also to those that 'offend, shock or disturb the State or any sector of the population.'
questions.explanationSL: V zadevi Handyside proti Združenemu kraljestvu (1976) je ESČP odločilo, da se svoboda izražanja ne nanaša le na informacije ali ideje, ki so ugodno sprejete, temveč tudi na tiste, ki 'žalijo, šokirajo ali vznemirjajo državo ali katerikoli del prebivalstva.'
questions.examTip: This is one of the most cited ECtHR cases on freedom of expression!

questions.question: What are enforced disappearances?
questions.questionSL: Kaj so prisilna izginotja?
options: Arrest or detention by state agents followed by refusal to acknowledge the deprivation of liberty
optionsSL: Aretacija ali pridržanje s strani državnih agentov, ki ji sledi zavrnitev priznanja odvzema prostosti
questions.explanation: The International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance (2006) defines enforced disappearance as arrest, detention, or abduction by state agents, followed by refusal to acknowledge the deprivation of liberty or concealment of the fate of the disappeared person.
questions.explanationSL: Mednarodna konvencija o zaščiti vseh oseb pred prisilnim izginotjem (2006) opredeljuje prisilno izginotje kot aretacijo, pridržanje ali ugrabitev s strani državnih agentov, ki ji sledi zavrnitev priznanja odvzema prostosti ali prikrivanje usode izginule osebe.
